etri.sdn.controller

Class OFModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • etri.sdn.controller.OFModule
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ForwardingBase, Hub, OFMDefaultEntityClassifier, OFMDeviceManager, OFMFirewall, OFMLearningMac, OFMLearningMac10, OFMLearningMac13, OFMLinkDiscovery, OFMStateManager, OFMStorageManager, OFMTopologyManager, OFMUserInterface

    public abstract class OFModule
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class is mother of all Torpedo modules. OFModule represents a reusable unit in defining a custom controller.
    Author:
    bjlee

    • Method Detail

      • registerModule

        public static void registerModule(java.lang.Class<? extends IService> c,
                  OFModule m)
        register a module to the static map modules.
        Parameters:
        c - represents a service that the module implements
        m - the module instance

      • getModule

        public static OFModule getModule(java.lang.Class<? extends IService> c)
        return a module that implements a specific service from the static map modules.
        Parameters:
        c - class of the service that this module implements
        Returns:
        OFModule object

      • registerFilter

        public void registerFilter(org.openflow.protocol.interfaces.OFMessageType messageType,
                  OFMFilter filter)
        register a filter that only selects messages that matches the condition described by the OFMFilter object.
        Parameters:
        messageType - type of the OFMessage that the filter applies
        filter - a filter object to be applied to OFMessage objects

      • init

        public final void init(IOFHandler ctrl)
        initialize module. This method is called by OFController.init().
        Parameters:
        ctrl - reference to the controller implementation

      • getController

        public IOFHandler getController()
        returns the controller that this modules is attached.
        Returns:
        reference to the controller implementation

      • initialize

        protected abstract void initialize()
        method that initializes this module. Subclass of OFModule must implement this method. You can find the example of this method in OFMLinkDiscovery.initialize().

      • processHandshakeFinished

        public boolean processHandshakeFinished(Connection conn,
                               MessageContext context)
        This method is called after FEATURE-REQUEST and FEATUER-REPLY is correctly exchanged. This method only calls handleHandshakedEvent(Connection, MessageContext), which is an abstract method that all subclasses should implement.
        Parameters:
        conn - connection on which the handshaking is done
        context - message context for the handshaking messages
        Returns:
        false when there is an critical error which prevents the successful operation of this module.

      • handleHandshakedEvent

        protected abstract boolean handleHandshakedEvent(Connection conn,
                            MessageContext context)
        An abstract method that all subclasses should implement. This method is called after FEATURE-REQUEST and FEATURE-REPLY is correct exchanged, by processHandshakeFinished(Connection, MessageContext). Normally, most of modules have very simple implementation for this method, only returning true.
        Parameters:
        conn - connection that the event has occurred
        context - message context for the handshaking messages
        Returns:
        true is returned when the event has been correctly processed. false otherwise.

      • processMessage

        public boolean processMessage(Connection conn,
                     MessageContext context,
                     org.openflow.protocol.OFMessage msg,
                     java.util.List<org.openflow.protocol.OFMessage> outgoing)
        Handle incoming messages and return the processing result. This method first applies filters for the message type to find out the message needs to be processed by this module. if the answer is yes, the message is passed to handleMessage(Connection, MessageContext, OFMessage, List).
        Parameters:
        conn - connection that the message has arrived
        context - message context for the message
        msg - the actual message object
        outgoing - responses for the message arrived
        Returns:
        true if the message has been correctly processed. false otherwise.

      • handleMessage

        protected abstract boolean handleMessage(Connection conn,
                    MessageContext context,
                    org.openflow.protocol.OFMessage msg,
                    java.util.List<org.openflow.protocol.OFMessage> outgoing)
        Handle incoming messages that pass the test of filters. All subclasses of OFModule must implement this method. This method is called by processMessage(Connection, MessageContext, OFMessage, List).
        Parameters:
        conn - connection that the message has arrived
        context - message context for the message
        msg - the actual message object
        outgoing - responses for the message arrived, which is filled by the handleMessage implementation
        Returns:
        true if the message has been correctly processed. false otherwise.

      • processDisconnect

        public boolean processDisconnect(Connection conn)
        Process the disconnection event from a switch. This method calls handleDisconnect(Connection) callback.
        Parameters:
        conn - connection that the event has occurred
        Returns:
        true if the event has been correctly processed. false otherwise.

      • handleDisconnect

        protected abstract boolean handleDisconnect(Connection conn)
        Process the disconnection event from a switch. This callback method is called by processDisconnect(Connection). All subclasses of OFModule should implement this method.
        Parameters:
        conn - connection that the event has occurred
        Returns:
        true if the event has been correctly processed. false otherwise.

      • getModels

        public abstract OFModel[] getModels()
        returns the array of all OFModel objects associated with this module. Normally the size of the array is one, but not limited to.
        Returns:
        the array of OFModel objects
